disable-safari-step-1.message: From the Safari toolbar, click the Adblock Plus icon and select Open Adblock Plus.

what-is-aac-1.message: As previously announced, in 2017 eyeo / Adblock Plus transferred governance of the Acceptable Ads initiative to an independent group, the Acceptable Ads Committee. The Acceptable Ads Committee consists of interested parties from for-profit companies, industry experts and Internet users like you.

distiction-criteria.message: Ads should always be recognizable as ads, and distinguishable from all other content (e.g. are not hiding the label, are not misleading users into thinking an ad is part of the primary content). Ads should be clearly marked with the word "advertisement" or its equivalent.

report-aa-step-3.message: If known, indicate whether a login or VPN is necessary to reproduce issue

report-aa-step-2.message: Screenshot of the entire page, including the ad OR a detailed description of where the ad is located on the page

report-aa-step-1.message: URL of the page where the ad appears

above-primary-content.message: When placed above the primary content, the maximum height of an ad should be 200px.

title.message: Allowing acceptable ads in Adblock Plus

get-whitelisted.message: How can I get ads on my website whitelisted?

why-is-aa-enabled-1.message: We believe that Acceptable Ads are the sustainable middle ground between a user’s choice to use an ad blocker and the continued need to support free online content with advertisements. If the majority of Adblock Plus users have the Acceptable Ads feature enabled, advertisers will have a bigger incentive to produce better, less intrusive ad formats.

animations-paragraph-1.message: Animations are allowed for the 6x1 ad type when placed as a ‘sticky’ ad on the bottom of the screen. Animations have to comply with the LEAN standard for animations, and a close button or some other closing mechanism must be included.

below-primary-content.message: When placed below the primary content, the maximum height of an ad should be 400px.

feed-list-ads.message: For ads in lists and feeds, the general criteria differ depending on:

what-is-aac-1-2.message: Link to the Acceptable Ads Committee website

what-is-aac-1-1.message: Link to blog post announcing the Acceptable Ads Committee

view-aa-list-1-1.message: Link to filter list with whitelisted websites

get-whitelisted-1.message: The process of getting your ads whitelisted takes about 10 working days once the ads adhere to the Acceptable Ads standards:

entries-feeds.message: Ads are permitted in between entries and feeds.

view-aa-list.message: Can I view the Acceptable Ads whitelist?

do-users-want-aa-1.message: Yes! Eighty three percent (83%) of Adblock Plus users don’t mind seeing Acceptable Ads because their browsing experience isn’t ruined by loud, annoying and irrelevant ads.

why-is-aa-enabled.message: Why is the Acceptable Ads feature enabled by default?

new-format.message: Are your ads displayed on alternative screens, or are you convinced that you have an innovative Acceptable Ads format which doesn't fit the ads outlined above? Let us know!

what-are-aa-3.message: Most websites use advertising to make money, meaning that you can see these websites for free. However, many websites use too many annoying or intrusive ads to get your attention. Adblock Plus lets you choose to block ads, but we don’t believe websites should be punished.

mobile-ads-size-item-1.message: Ads implemented on the scrollable portion of the webpage must not occupy in total more than 50 percent of the visible portion of the webpage.

mobile-ads-size-item-2.message: Ads implemented as a ‘sticky ad’ have a maximum height restriction of 75px (or 15%).

mobile-ads-size-item-3.message: Below the Primary Content, ads are limited to 100% of the screen space.

mobile-ads-placement-item-3.message: Large ad types (e.g. native tile ads) are only allowed to be placed under the Primary Content.

mobile-ads-placement-item-2.message: Small ads (6x1 banner or smaller) are allowed to be placed as a sticky ad on the bottom of the screen. Other formats are not allowed to stick.

mobile-ads-placement-item-1.message: Static ad types (e.g. 6x1 banner and 1x1 tile ad) are allowed to be placed anywhere on the mobile page

in-feed-ads-size.message: In-feed ads are permitted to take up more space, as long as they are not substantially larger than other elements in the list or feed.

total-ad-space.message: All ads that are placed above the fold (the portion of the web page visible in the browser window when the page first loads under the common screen size), must not occupy in total more than 15 percent of the visible portion of the web page. If placed below the fold, ads must not occupy in total more than 25 percent of the visible portion of the webpage.

disable-latest-step-1.message: From your browser’s toolbar, click the Adblock Plus icon and select the gear icon in the upper right corner.

disable-latest-step-2.message: From the General tab, scroll to the Acceptable Ads section.

what-are-aa-1.message: Acceptable Ads are ads that aren’t intrusive or annoying. They are respectful, don’t interfere with content, and are clearly labeled with the word “advertisement” or its equivalent. In order for an ad to be an “Acceptable Ad”, it must adhere to standards that have been set forth by the Acceptable Ads Committee.

what-are-aa-2.message: Ads that abide by Acceptable Ads standards are placed on a whitelist. The ads on the whitelist are then shown to ad-blocking users who allow Acceptable Ads.

what-are-aa-wo-1.message: Acceptable Ads without third-party tracking are ads that comply with the Acceptable Ads criteria and that do not allow third-party entities to track any of your browsing behavior. These are ads that comply with Do Not Track, and / or ads which are served by the domain which is wholly owned by the same company.

only-text-ads.message: Only text ads are allowed. For webpages without any primary content (e.g. error or parking pages), the criteria differ depending on:

get-whitelisted-step-2.message: Someone from eyeo, the company behind Adblock Plus, will contact you to determine the exact ads, and check whether they comply with our criteria.

get-whitelisted-step-1.message: If your website has ads that comply with the Acceptable Ads standards, simply fill out this form.

get-whitelisted-step-4.message: We submit the whitelisting proposal in the forum and the ads are whitelisted at the same time. The topic will stay open in order for the community to declare concerns if or when the candidate does not meet the requirements.

side-primary-content.message: When placed on the side of the primary content, the maximum width of an ad should be 350px.

disable-ie-step-1.message: Click the Adblock Plus icon and select Settings.

mobile-ads-size-lead.message: Ads showing on mobile screens are bound to the following size restrictions:

page-under-review.message: This page is under review as management of the Acceptable Ads initiative has been transferred to the independent Acceptable Ads Committee.

get-whitelisted-step-3-1.message: Link to Acceptable Ads agreements page

search-ads-info.message: For search ads - ads displayed following a user-initiated search query - the criteria differ depending on:

desktop-criteria-1.message: Ads must not disrupt the user's natural reading flow. Such ads must be placed on top, side or below the Primary Content.

are-all-aa-blocked-1.message: No. It isn't technically possible to automatically recognize ads that don’t meet the Acceptable Ads criteria. We have agreements with some websites and advertisers which stipulate that only advertisements matching the Acceptable Ads criteria will be displayed when Adblock Plus users visit these particular sites.

size-criteria.message: Individual ad-size requirements depend on the placement of the ad:

view-aa-list-1.message: Absolutely. You can view the list by clicking here.

disable-latest.message: Adblock Plus for Chrome, Firefox (versions 3 and above), Maxthon, Opera, Yandex Browser

disable-firefox-step-1.message: Click the Adblock Plus icon and select Filter preferences.

footnote-9.message: From: Iab New Standard Ad Unit Portfolio (2017)

footnote-8.message: This means that users can scroll past the primary content and an ad unit served after it can take up the whole screen; but following this ad unit, additional ads cannot be implemented.

footnote-4.message: The 'common screen size' for tablets is 768x1024, based on data from StatCounter.

footnote-7.message: The visible portion of the webpage is defined as a standard CSS pixel size of 360x512px (Samsung Galaxy S7 with the SBrowser), which is based on the standard viewport of 360x640px, but with the OS- and browser UI elements deducted.

footnote-1.message:
The 'Primary Content' is defined as (based on Mozilla's description of the
HTML element): The Primary Content consists of content that is directly related to, or expands upon the central topic of a document or the central functionality of an application. This content should be unique to the document, excluding any content that is repeated across a set of documents such as sidebars, navigation links, copyright information, site logos, and search forms (unless, of course, the document's main function is a search form).

footnote-3.message: The 'common screen size' for mobile is 360x640, based on data from StatCounter.

footnote-2.message: The 'common screen size' for desktop is 1366x768, based on data from StatCounter.

size-2.message: Ads must always leave sufficient space for the Primary Content on the common screen size of 1366x768 for desktop, 360x640 for mobile devices and 768x1024 for tablets.

disable-samsung-step-1.message: Open Adblock Plus for Samsung Internet.

what-is-aac.message: What is the Acceptable Ads Committee?

aa-criteria-1.message: Acceptable Ads, as defined by the Acceptable Ads Committee, have to comply with the following criteria:

more-space.message: Search ads are permitted to be larger and take up additional screen space.

do-users-want-aa.message: Do Adblock Plus users really want Acceptable Ads?

get-whitelisted-step-3.message: After you have made any necessary changes, both sides sign an agreement.

disable-ios-safari-step-2.message: Tap the Settings icon at the bottom of the page.

disable-ios-safari-step-3.message: From the Settings page, tap Acceptable Ads.

report-aa-1.message: Send a message to email address with the following information:

unobtrusive-image.message: Static image ads may qualify as acceptable, according to an evaluation of their unobtrusiveness based on their integration on the webpage.

hate-ads-1.message: No problem, you can disable this feature at any time:

no-primary-content.message: Ads on pages with no primary content

attention-grab.message: Text ads designed with excessive use of colors and/or other elements to grab attention are not permitted.

report-aa.message: How do I report an ad that doesn’t meet the criteria?

what-are-aa-wo.message: What are Acceptable Ads without third-party tracking?

meta-description.message: Adblock Plus introduces the Acceptable Ads initiative: Support websites that rely on advertising but choose to do it in a non-intrusive way.

revenue-1.message: Click here for a detailed overview of our financials.
